start.question: What are you having trouble with?

exchange_poloniex_delist.answer: Poleniex delisted DigiByte.  There is no way to recover your coins now.  Your only chance and it is a small one is to contact a lawyer
exchange_poloniex_delist.question: Do you still need help?

options.format_receive: Invalid address when I try to withdraw DGB
options.format_send: Invalid address when I try to deposit DGB

exchange_cant_help.answer: You will need to contact the exchange for assistance.
exchange_cant_help.question: Do you still need help?

format_receive.answer: The person/company trying to send you funds is using outdated code.  Try providing them a legacy address(one that starts with D).  If your wallet does not have this option download Coinomi and use it.
format_receive.question: Do you still need help?

format_send.answer: The wallet you are using is outdated.  Recommend installing Coinomi as it supports all modern address formats.
format_send.question: Do you still need help?

dead_go.answer: DigiByte Go is dead. Recommend you download Coinomi or another wallet and use DigiSweep.digiassetX.com to recover your funds
dead_go.question: Do you still need help?

wallet_cant_recover.question: What wallet type do you have?

options.wallet_bip39_standards: Recovered on a different wallet and balance is 0

wallet_bip39_invalid_word.answer: This is usually a result of typing a word in incorrectly. Please make sure all the words are spelt exactly the same as found on this word list. Accents are important if present.
wallet_bip39_invalid_word.question: Do you still need help?

wallet_bip39_standards.question: What wallet where you using before?

wallet_bip39_standards_digibyte_mobile.answer: Unfortunately DigiByte Mobile is not a standard compliant wallet. You can only restore funds from DigiByte Mobile on DigiByte mobile or use DigiSweep to move to your new wallet
wallet_bip39_standards_digibyte_mobile.question: Do you still need help?

wallet_bip39_standards_compliant.answer: Your old wallet was likely standard compliant.  If your new wallet does not see the funds you should try using Coinomi instead.
wallet_bip39_standards_compliant.question: Do you still need help?

wallet_core_restore.question: What operating system are you running?

wallet_core_restore_windows.answer: Open a file explorer and in the address bar type %appData%\DigiByte then copy your wallet.dat file to this folder.(If you named it something else rename it to wallet.dat)
wallet_core_restore_windows.question: Do you need help installing the newest wallet?

wallet_core_restore_mac.answer: Goto ~/Library/Application Support/DigiByte/ then copy your wallet.dat file to this folder.(If you named it something else rename it to wallet.dat)
wallet_core_restore_mac.question: Do you need help installing the newest wallet?

wallet_core_restore_linux.answer: goto ~/.digibyte/ then copy your wallet.dat file to this folder.(If you named it something else rename it to wallet.dat)
wallet_core_restore_linux.question: Do you need help installing the newest wallet?

wallet_core_update.question: Have you run the wallet since the last fork?(July 2019)

wallet_core_stuck.answer: Shut down your core wallet.  Once shut down continue bellow
wallet_core_stuck.question: What operating system are you using?

wallet_core_delete_blocks_windows.answer: Open a file explorer and in the address bar type %appData%\DigiByte then delete the blocks and indexes folders if they exist. Install the newest wallet and start it up if you haven't already.
wallet_core_delete_blocks_windows.question: Do you still need help?

wallet_core_delete_blocks_mac.answer: Goto ~/Library/Application Support/DigiByte/ then delete the blocks and indexes folders if they exist. Install the newest wallet and start it up if you haven't already.
wallet_core_delete_blocks_mac.question: Do you still need help?

wallet_core_delete_blocks_linux.answer: goto ~/.digibyte/ then delete the blocks and indexes folders if they exist. Install the newest wallet and start it up if you haven't already.
wallet_core_delete_blocks_linux.question: Do you still need help?

wallet_not_synced.question: Have you tried syncing the waller?

options.wallet_core_less_then_have: Yes: I was using a really old core wallet

wallet_wont_sync_mobile.answer:
This is likely a DNS issue caused by a lot of budget / freely provided home routers. You want to do the following steps:

Turn off your WiFi on your phone
Power off your device
Power it back on while connected to JUST mobile-data such as a 3G / 4G data connection
Fire up the DigiByte mobile app and wait for the syncing to begin
Once syncing has begun, you can re-join your WiFi
You must do these steps in this order so that when your phone powers on, it asks your mobile-carrier for DNS. Often times home routers will keep providing stale DNS entries to devices such as Cellphones on WiFi, meaning even if you reboot your phone while on WiFi you still won't have much luck.

It should begin to sync within a couple of seconds once you have re-opened the app again.

Should you still have issues even following this troubleshooting steps above, you can also go to Menu -> Settings -> Sync blockchain, and it will perform a full re-sync. This will not affect your funds, but will take approx 20-30 minutes.
wallet_wont_sync_mobile.question: Do you still need help?

wallet_core_less_then_have.answer: Download Coinomi or another wallet on your phone then in the debug console run walletpassphrase yourpassword 60 to unlock your wallet then dumpwallet filename to save your private keys to a file. Open the file in a text editor and use either Coinomi's sweep function or https://DigiSweep.digiassetX.com to sweep your funds to the new wallet.
wallet_core_less_then_have.question: Do you still need help?

wallet_cant_send.question: There are a few reasons this may be please pick the one that best applies:

options.wallet_miner: I mined to the wallet or received lots of small transactions
options.format_send: Says address I am sending to is invalid

wallet_miner_core.answer: You likely have to many UTXOs in your wallet. You can fix this by sending a smaller amount to yourself a few times or if you have been mining you may want to go to the console and type dumpprivkey miningaddress. Then use DigiSweep.digiassetX.com to send the funds from the provided private key back to your wallet.
wallet_miner_core.question: Do you still need help?

wallet_miner_other.answer: Your wallet is probably no longer functional because there are to many UTXOs. DigiSweep.digiassetX.com can be used to move all your funds to a new address and fix this problem.
wallet_miner_other.question: Did this fix your problem?

wallet_asset_cant_send.question: Do you have any DigiByte in the Wallet?

wallet_asset_no_funds.answer: You must have at least 0.001 DGB in your wallet to send DigiAssets
wallet_asset_no_funds.question: Do you still have a problem?

wallet_asset_cant_send2.question: Does the address you are trying to send to start with dgb1?

wallet_asset_ask_legacy.answer: Ask the person you are trying to send to, to get a legacy address.  It will show under qr code on there phone.
wallet_asset_ask_legacy.question: Do you still need help?

warn.challenge:
Warning!

There are scammers everywhere.
Never accept support in a private message even if they look like an admin.
Remember many eyes keep everyone honest.
To continue type 'I wont give away my keys' in the box below
warn.answer: I wont give away my keys

done_no_help.answer:
Sorry this could not help you.
Please go to DGBSupport on telegram and ask your question.
